javax.swing.plaf.nimbus

Class NimbusDefaults.LazyStyle

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.plaf.nimbus.NimbusDefaults.LazyStyle
  • Enclosing class:
    NimbusDefaults

    private final class NimbusDefaults.LazyStyle
extends Object
    A class which creates the NimbusStyle associated with it lazily, but also manages a lot more information about the style. It is less of a LazyValue type of class, and more of an Entry or Item type of class, as it represents an entry in the list of LazyStyles in the map m. The primary responsibilities of this class include:
    • Determining whether a given component/region pair matches this style
    • Splitting the prefix specified in the constructor into its constituent parts to facilitate quicker matching
    • Creating and vending a NimbusStyle lazily.

    • Field Detail

      • prefix

        private String prefix
        The prefix this LazyStyle was registered with. Something like Button or ComboBox:"ComboBox.arrowButton"

      • simple

        private boolean simple
        Whether or not this LazyStyle represents an unnamed component

      • parts

        private NimbusDefaults.LazyStyle.Part[] parts
        The various parts, or sections, of the prefix. For example, the prefix: ComboBox:"ComboBox.arrowButton" will be broken into two parts, ComboBox and "ComboBox.arrowButton"

      • style

        private NimbusStyle style
        Cached shared style.

    • Method Detail

      • getStyle

        SynthStyle getStyle(JComponent c,
                  Region r)
        Gets the style. Creates it if necessary.
        Returns:
        the style

      • matches

        boolean matches(JComponent c)
        This LazyStyle is a match for the given component if, and only if, for each part of the prefix the component hierarchy matches exactly. That is, if given "a":something:"b", then: c.getName() must equals "b" c.getParent() can be anything c.getParent().getParent().getName() must equal "a".

      • matches

        private boolean matches(Component c,
              int partIndex)

        Given some dot separated prefix, split on the colons that are not within quotes, and not within brackets.

        Returns:
